title: Did workers used to get bonus payments for their hard work in the Soviet Union? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. There were multiple bonuses. “13th salary”, paid at the end of the year and monthly premiyas (premium, bonus). You would be required to meet the production norm in order to get those. But if you just came to work every day and didn’t go on drinking binges (a Soviet plague of the 1960s through 1980s), it was totally feasible.
For an example. Miner Alexey Stakhanov produced 102 tonnes of anthracite at a rate of 7.5 tonnes, receiving a bonus 220 roubles for this - more than half the average monthly salary.
